author: tokenallies
title: Bringing Business to Cardano
description: Real world businesses have no easy access to Crypto Funding Capital

f6_assessments.q0: The aim of the proposal is to create a no-barrier crowdfunding platform, where the people who are asking for funds, will tokenize their “business” using cardano native tokens, e.g. I have a business, and I want to get funded, so I tokenize my brand into e.g. 10k tokens, which can be bought by investors. So in short, these will represent stocks in digital form. So investors will have to really consider to who they invest, because tokens will represent the success of the requestors. The proposers plan to meet the challenge goal by approaching the current existing projects on other chains to bring them in, and they are already having discussions with polkadot community, therefore these are aligned with the challenge goal. Regarding the risks, I completely agree that the biggest risk will be to keep the traction. Nevertheless, primarily, I believe it will be serving for onboarding, and to support any type of business, and also increase the awareness regarding the Cardano. The only information I failed to find is how the value of these new tokens will be maintained (I believe, there will be required a legally bounding document claiming that by owning of tokens of particular company, you are actually having their share).
f6_assessments.q1: The roadmap is set to 3 months, whereas the first month is described in weeks 1-2 and 3-4 with activities planned for this time period. Most of these activities are focused on marketing and information sharing, and I find the detail regarding sufficient. The total budget is set to 10 329 USD, and is broken down into multiple items. For the item Content and Community manager – I am missing information what is the expected time donation (full time, part time) and possibly hourly wage. For the item “Paid promotions” I am missing information whether the amount is based on some pre-agreed amount, or if some research was already performed and we know that the budget is based on some information, or whether it is just a guess. The team is having 3 partners and currently is having 7 members in total, from different countries.  I like the fact, that some representatives were selected and their bio + linked in profiles are disclosed. I find their skills and expertise matching the requirements for the planned activities.
f6_assessments.q2: The progress indicators are following the roadmap and to track the progress whether these are delivered, reports to the catalyst community will be posted. For more frequent reports, public channels such as twitter or telegram or discord can be used. Regarding the success of the proposal, the number of boarded projects, interested projects and launched projects is going to be measured. I think, the most reliable metric would be the number of projects that launched on the platform are actually originally from different chains, or, if possible, to somehow monitor funders origin (since we want to increase cross chain collaboration, we can have projects from different chains, or investors from different chains, and both of these will result in increased cross-chain collab.)

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal would be within the challenge goal, and I think that this proposal probably will increase transaction on Cardano blockchain, through Cardano's blockchain native multi token capabilities, facilitating the mechanisms for Tokenization of businesses by minting Digital Assets in the Cardano blockchain, enabling funding and liquidity for both the company and the investors. 
At the same time the statement of how problem is to be solved is only high-level explained and in my opinion it doesn’t clear how the funding market will adopt these features, and it doesn’t clear how this proposal can create incentive for customers and stakeholders.
I think it's important to improve details about the proposal services solution for the challenge (eg. Typical services use case for funding investors, example benefit for service consumers and for Cardano community, …)
f6_assessments.q1:
There are all link in the proposal that refers to the proposal members, and the skill in my opinion is coherent with the proposal. There are 3 partners from Argentina and they are active members in Catalyst community.
The scope of the solution is explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, what features will be implemented, and so on…). There is a too simple cost worksheet, that doesn’t contain all costs (eg. Infrastructure, cloud license, etc.)
The plan for implementation and market adoption is very simple and must have been a bit more specific.
f6_assessments.q2:
The given metrics measure what the proposer wants to do. As mentioned above, the description of the solution is basic explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, how the solution improves their customer experience, and so on…), so the progress of this proposal is simple to assess.
The proposer belong from two successfull Fund7 and Fund8 proposals.
f6_assessments.reply: Note to the PA: This proposal is a continuation of a F7 and F8 funded proposals, many of your doubts and questions are described there. And those links to previous proposals are part of the submission of this one. You should've read those. Anyhow we welcome and thanks for your comments and feedback.

f6_assessments.q0: I believe Cardano has many use cases and we have seen crowdfunding as being one of them but it has not gained much attention in the past. It is nice to see such a proposal  enabling funding and liquidity for both the company and the investors. Seeing that the team has been funded for different projects, in other sections,  proves that we are talking about an experienced group of people that are taking seriously the cross-chain collaboration thing, getting in touch with people from the Polkadot community. The whitepaper explains everything in great detail and i think that the team has great potential. I definitely think that this project will have a good impact on the ecosystem and its value is clearly articulated in this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: All the team members and their relevant skills, with all the links provided, the necessary skills and resources, a detailed plan and the architecture/langueage that will be implemented are all there and suffieciently described, even though the linkedin profile or another social profile of the last member would also be useful. The budget is described in a clear manner as well, and has been broken down into identifiable manners. I would like to see what exactly each member is going to be responsible of from the intentifiable items that were mentioned above. Four months seem as a quite realsitic time horizon and it is nice to see that it is a step by step kind of an approach. The risks were also mentioned and all in all, except from some minor details that could be corrected the proposal is a feasible one.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a roadmap with milestones in it and some key metrics needed to measure the success of the proposal with numbers, for example the projects on boarded by the end of the proposal 
or the projects interested in working with the platform. That is something we don't see often and is very useful for the whole community to consider.  The progress of the proposal can be tracked though the site provided and that is an important fact for the auditability of the proposal. All points included, i think that this proposal has more than suffiecient information to audit the progress and the success of it.

f6_assessments.q0: The suggestion is a clear concept that is expressed in full. This might have a very large impact. Unquestionably, bringing in and integrating ecosystem companies, products, and developers is advantageous for the Cardano chain. However, it is also important to bring in outside companies and developers by providing support in any form that is practical. And I think that this proposal successfully complies with their demands. With Cardano, it's straightforward to enable funding and liquidity for both the company and the investors' thanks to its inherent multi-token blockchain features. In order to enable such a phenomenon, the author advises developing and providing a platform as a service so that companies can plan, build, administer, and sell their tokens. This proposal is an addition to another made by the same team, and it is just being made for research purposes. This proposal is specifically intended to conduct research on and identify the companies that the team believes are deserving of integration into their system. Thus, if this project were to be implemented properly, it would significantly affect the chain by bringing in new business owners and clever developers.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no doubt regarding the proposers' skills because Alan and Harry appear to be leaders in their professions and would provide outstanding support for the research project. It's also critical to acknowledge the work put into developing the plan. The proposer provides the community and readers with a detailed road map that includes the necessary resources, potential dangers, and quantitative indicators. A brief introduction to the team and the expertise they might bring to the ecosystem is provided by the team, along with a note that some of the developer and project management positions have already been filled. Since some of the team members have had success in prior rounds, there is a good possibility that the proposal will be successful. The suggested funds are relatively acceptable when compared to the challenge's overall budget. The distribution also seems acceptable given how little developers of competing solutions are paid per head. It is obvious from the available facts that this plan has a fair possibility of being implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has more of a groundwork outlook rather than its sibling project which is more development oriented. The author understands this very fundamental difference and provides suitable metrics accordingly. Progress metrics are defined distinctively for each of the phases and are very closely aligned with the milestones specified in the tentative timeline of the team. The outcome KPIs such as the number of projects onboarded, attendance on the team's social media channels, and the traffic on their website could be wonderful metrics to measure the progress and acceptance levels of the proposal by the community. With the quantifiable metrics with a figure against them are used to help the community picture what the success of the proposal would look like. Provided the team has another project which also looks promising that goes hand-in-hand with the current proposal, the community can assume that the team would provide all the required assistance to track their progress and evaluate their success/failure.

f6_assessments.q0: While the proposal mentions collaborations with Polkadot, no clear objectives were given for increasing collaboration between blockchains. I'm not sure how a crowdfunding mechanic on Cardano will help increase the collaboration level between us and other chains. While I think this proposal has a place as an onboarding tool between businesses and Cardano, I'm not sure cross chain collaboration is the right category. With the focus of cross chain being other blockchain communities, a brief mention of Polkadot didn't make me feel confident in this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: I think the team shows signs of strength. They seem to have some good experience; however, I believe they still need to work through some key business decisions around how they plan on making this all work. After reading the plan, I can't confidently say I see this proposal being fully implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: I think the auditability of the proposal is fairly straight forward. However, I noticed that they identified projects joining the program on Cardano as a KPI, but avoided giving deadlines on when they expected to see the growth. If the goal is 20 projects onboarded by the end of the proposal (as stated), I would like to see projections on when they expect to have the first project, fifth project, etc. This will be a key indicator of whether or not the team is being successful. Without this metric being used for auditability, the team could defer responsibility if the project does not show signs of positive results, making auditability tricky for this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The objective of the project is to connect investors and businesses and taking advantage of the multi token capabilities of the Cardano Network, help to tokenize real business. By aiming to add other chains in the crypto space, the project strongly helps with the challenge objective as it will link other chains with Cardano as the main chain, with projects and investors from all sides.
f6_assessments.q1:
The timeline is clear, divided by deliverables on planning, creation of materials and execution with milestones and times clearly stated.
The team has all the skills needed for the project and even they have proven experience in Catalyst, so it is clear they have what the project needs to be delivered.
In terms of budget is detailed by role and the costs are in line with what I see in the region. The total budget requested is ok for a project with this aim.
f6_assessments.q2: The project has both Outcomes and Progress indicators, well detailed and clearly defined, so the community will have no problems in audit and track this project. The aim of the goals vs the required budget it is coherent and reasonable.

solution: Close the gap between Real World businesses looking for funding and crypto investors with a Cardano based Crowdfunding platform
experience: A Strong experience doing digital businesses in LATAM, acquiring unique capabilities & resiliency in complex environments & economic conditions, which enables us to understand & adapt to this culturally diverse region. Key factors when generating trust & interest
